result.execSummary:
The defendant Faredin H Muedini was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson w/ Intent to Defraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.04.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Faredin H Muedini
parties.address: 3775 East Denton Avenue #76, St Francis, WI 53235

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 65 days time served.
Same conditions as probation except for condition time.

miscConds.notes:
*Restitution set at $0.
*Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
*Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job.
*Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

*No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
*No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
*No alcohol or controlled substances.

*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: *As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on October 30, 2015 at 5:00 p.m.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Faredin H Muedini in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 65 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on October 30, 2015 at 5:00 p.m. 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconvictin Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet
Filed, Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Faredin H Muedini in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  State requests a Presentence Investigation Report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Faredin H Muedini in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Faredin H Muedini not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Parties may have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Faredin H Muedini in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Faredin H Muedini in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Faredin H Muedini in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Faredin H Muedini in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Faredin H Muedini not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 5-5-2015. Defendant is in custody at HOC. Needs to be produced for court. Both files sent to case prep for OTP by Sheriff's department.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
